in a way that relates to the scientific description of the different types of rock: The thin beds of rocks are petrographically distinct from the thicker beds. The two groups of rocks are petrographically indistinguishable regardless of their type and age.
More examplesFewer examplesThe rocks formed in the Lower Triassic period are petrographically diverse.The sandy beds are found with petrographically dissimilar sandstones which belong to a separate system of deposits.The team found a petrographically similar basalt lying above the main strata.
